items.title: Rondje KNVB-beker: Ajax slaat modderfiguur, PSV soeverein
items.summary: Het is tijd voor Rondje Eurojackpot KNVB Beker! Ajax werd woensdag genadeloos op de pijnbank gelegd door AZ, terwijl PSV zonder veel moeite afrekende met FC Den Bosch. We hebben het donderdagochtend uitgebreid over deze achtstefinaleduels.

items.title: 'Intern conflict' bij Kompany na indrukwekkend record met Bayern
items.summary: Bayern M√ºnchen heeft woensdag een eigen record verbeterd door de eerste seizoenshelft af te sluiten met een overwinning bij FC K√∂ln. Trainer Vincent Kompany treedt daardoor uit de schaduw van zijn leermeester Pep Guardiola.

items.title: Marco van Basten komende maanden niet bij Ziggo Sport te zien
items.summary: Marco van Basten is voorlopig niet meer bij Ziggo Sport te zien. De analyticus kampt met een vervelende priv√©situatie. Daardoor doet hij een stap terug.

items.title: Porto deelt sneer uit aan Mourinho, terwijl Farioli hem als 'rolmodel' prijst
items.summary: Jos√© Mourinho stevent af op een seizoen zonder prijzen bij Benfica. The Special One beleefde een pijnlijke bekeravond bij voormalig werkgever en aartsrivaal Porto, dat na afloop een klein sneertje uitdeelde. Tegelijkertijd was er alle lof voor Francesco Farioli, die Mourinho als een rolmodel ziet.

items.title: 'Onmisbare' Arsenal-schakel gevonden: 'Precies wat Partey en Jorginho misten'
items.summary: De Engelse media zijn dit seizoen overtuigd geraakt van Mart√≠n Zubimendi. De Baskische controleur is het cement van het Arsenal-middenveld, iets waar het de laatste jaren aan ontbrak bij The Gunners . Niet voor niets is hij de veldspeler met de meeste speelminuten bij Arsenal.

items.title: Fernandes not seeking to leave Man Utd in January
items.summary: Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes is not planning to seek a move away from the club this month.

items.title: Arsenal take first step to end long-standing semifinal curse
items.summary: In a thriller at Stamford Bridge, Mikel Arteta's Arsenal took a major step toward ending a major trophy drought that has lingered for years.

items.title: Sports piracy explodes in UK with 3.6bn illegal streams and rise of black-market bookmakers
items.summary: Unlicensed betting has surged over the last four years Gambling Commission accused of underestimating issue The number of illegal streams of sports events in Britain has more than doubled to 3.6bn in the past three years according to a new report, which provides a stark illustration of the challenge facing broadcasters and leagues in combating piracy. The Campaign for Fairer Gambling‚Äôs national 2024-25 report also highlights that there is a symbiotic relationship between sports piracy and unlicensed gambling, with 89% of illegal streams in this country featuring adverts for black-market bookmakers. Continue reading...

items.title: Raducanu stunned by Preston ahead of Australian Open
items.summary: Emma Raducanu's preparations for the Australian Open took a hit after she was stunned 6-2 6-4 by Taylah Preston in the quarter-finals of the Hobart International.

items.title: Football transfer rumours: Everton to sign Youssef En-Nesyri and Callum Wilson?
items.summary: Today‚Äôs rumours are air-tight David Moyes is a keen admirer of massive centre-forwards, so it should not come as a surprise that Everton want to bring in all 6ft 2in of Youssef En-Nesyri from Fenerbahce. An initial loan offer, with a ¬£20m option, is on the table for the Moroccan, leaving a decision to made in Istanbul. There is a chance Callum Wilson could swap West Ham for Merseyside to join up with Moyes, too. Nottingham Forest are also interested in En-Nesyri but their main striking target is Olympiakos‚Äô veteran forward, Mehdi Taremi. Sean Dyche was hoping for a quiet month but needs must and that could include sending Oleksandr Zinchenko back to Arsenal after a very forgettable loan spell at the City Ground. Continue reading...

items.title: Sims: Dubois would ruin Fury's comeback with 'phenomenal' power
items.summary: Daniel Dubois would ruin Tyson Fury's comeback with his 'phenomenal' punch power, says new trainer Tony Sims.

items.title: New Zealand sack head coach Robertson
items.summary: New Zealand head coach Scott Robertson has been sacked after a damning internal report into the team's 2025 season and reported threats from senior players to quit if he was not removed.

items.title: What does xG predict for the rest of the season?
items.summary: With more than half the season gone, we have enough stats to get a good idea of how well Premier League teams have been playing and therefore how things will likely unfold in the months ahead.

items.title: Raducanu in line for Sabalenka rematch after Australian Open draw
items.summary: Emma Raducanu has been handed a tough path at the Australian Open despite being seeded, with world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka potentially awaiting in the third round.

items.title: Arbeloa: Madrid Copa exit to 2nd-tier side 'painful'
items.summary: New Real Madrid coach √Ålvaro Arbeloa took responsibility for the team's "painful" 3-2 Copa del Rey defeat to second-tier Albacete on Wednesday, defending his decision to rest a number of senior players.

items.title: Chelsea's Rosenior: Blame me for S√°nchez errors
items.summary: Liam Rosenior has urged Chelsea fans to blame him for Robert S√°nchez's two mistakes which helped Arsenal to a 3-2 victory in Wednesday's Carabao Cup semifinal, first leg at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: FIFA requests for World Cup tickets passes 500M
items.summary: FIFA said Wednesday it has received more than 500 million ticket requests for this year's World Cup.

items.title: Eto'o banned over alleged AFCON misbehavior
items.summary: Cameroonian Football Federation president Samuel Eto'o has been suspended for four games for alleged misbehavior during his team's loss to Morocco at the Africa Cup of Nations.
